text: 11.10.2014. Smells like.. sahti. Juniper, wheat, wood, grass. Taste has juniper, malts, wheat and warmth of alco. Its somehow easier to drink than many other sahti Ive tasted.

(Draught at Bryggeri Helsinki, 13 Nov 2014) Hazy reddish amber colour with brief beige head. Malty, fruity nose with dried fruit, raisins, juniper berries, fruit cake and a touch of old sweaty socks. Malty, fruity taste with notes of dried fruit, raisins, apricots, brown sugar, juniper and a fairly sweet finish with low bitterness. Almost full body, quite sweet. Interesting and quite tasty. Nice and warming.

Tap @ Bryggeri Helsinki, Helsinki. Pours a dirty hazy, dark orange with a small, very brown head. Aroma is sweet and stuffy, berries, juniper. Taste is cloyingly sweet. Caramel, berries, juniper. Much too sweet. Full with decent carbonation.

Tap at brewpub. Murky nut brown color, small beige head. Strong juniper, woody aroma. Medium-bodied. Good amount of juniper in the flavor. Light banana fruityness but more on dry side, not very estery. Notes of alcohol. Juniper overdose. I prefer a bit more sweet Sahtis.
Tap@ olutexpo 2014. Deep amber, no head. Banana, yeast, fruity aroma. Flavor has ripe banana, yeast, sweet fruits. Long sweet finish. Great sahti. Top 5.

Draught. Pours unclear darker copper in color with a small whitish head. Sweet notes in aroma, part honey and part some sweet malts, also some forresty spicyness is present. Little bit of banana and sweet berries mixed with some wooden juniper notes in taste. Tart finish.

Light sewage, clay dirty nose, sweet malty. Junipers (bit twigsy), herby green hoppy, slight rye sweetish malty flavour. Soft body, medium full, light bitter finish. More of a beery sahti- the bitters, and more of a beery (lighter, cleaner) body. Not that much of the sahti esters either, but malty at least.

Juniper, rye and roasted malt in aroma. Taste is a bit sour and has a long aftertaste. Flavors of juniper, liquorices, roasted malt and rye. Nice one.

Hazy copper color with blonde head. Aroma has juniper and sweet rye. Slight tartness as well. Flavor has sweet banana and strawberry with yeastiness, juniper and rye. Some sourness as well. Palate is soft and thick. Finish is long with sourness and juniper. A totally different type of sahti than the ones Ive tasted before, banana is on the background.

On tao at Pikkulintu, October 2013. (rating nr 1000 this year)

Hazy brownish/orange with a small white head. The aroma was rather sweet with a lot of malt, yeast, some alcohol, and spices. The taste was similar. Also some caramel. Almost no carbonation. An interesting one, I very seldom drink a Sahti.
Reddish brown. Honey, caramel, hints of tar. Sweet, above all. Im no expert on sahti, but found this quite enjoyable.

On tap at One Pint Pub.  Burnt orange pour with a white head.  Caramel malt and herbal tea aromas..  Lots of sweet malt with some herbal/floral notes.  A little watery in the mouthfeel for 11.5%.  Has a somewhat tea like quality to it.  Very sweet.

Draught @ One Pint Pub, Helsinki

Pours dark orange with a foamy head. Aroma of caramely malts, toffee, honey and farmhouse notes. Taste is sweet and malty with caramely notes and hints of smoke and toffee. Finish is yeasty and malty with sweetish notes. Nice, quite well balanced sahti, but Im still not the biggest fan of the style.
Gedronken in de plaatselijke brouwerij in Tampere. Donker geel bier. Sterk, zoet met aromas van caramel. Smaakt zoals een honingbier? Voor mij te zoet.
Tap at Kuikka. Nice sahti, bit on the sweet side. Totally enjoyable and well brewed. I really want more.
Draught @ Oluthuone Leskinen, Oulu. Hazy orange / brown sahti with white head. Aroma and taste were sweet malts with banana and spices. A sahti worthy of Unto Tikkanens memory.

Draught @ Plevna. Pours hazy chestnut colour with minimal lacing white head. Aroma is yeasty with some banana, toffee and juniper. Really sweet taste with sugar, tar and banana. Taste reminds a bit the finnish pastille called "Tervapastilli". Medium bodied, low to medium carbonation and a slick mouthfeel. Definately a good sahti but a bit too sweet.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Bank, Turku. Hazy orangeish brown colour with a small off-white head. Aroma is banana, juniper, some spices, yeast and mild toffee as well. Flavour is banana, spices, juniper, yeast, some raisins, toffee and mild fruity notes. Caramelly, yeasty and mildly spicy aftertaste. Rather bodied.

Draught @ Oluthuone Leskinen. Hazy, dark yellow to brown sahti with dense fine head. Strong, sweet malty and caramelly aroma with heavy yeast phenols and some alcohol. Sweetish, slightly sugary flavor. Lacks malty depth. It is almost wheaty resembling weizenbocks to a degree. A punch of alcohol in the finish, as it should be. Juicy, rather full and oily texture with light carbonation (usually sahti is flat). Personally, I think that carbonation this light is OK. Not a benchmark sahti, but highly drinkable.

Draght at Harrys, Jyväskylä. Slightly hazy orange brown color. Aromas of ripe banana with sweet toffeish maltiness. Sweetish taste with ripe banana, herbal juniper and toffeish, nutty and caramelly maltiness and hint of smoke. Medium to full body,  lighter than sahti on average. Plenty of ripe banana but otherwise clean fermentation. Good sahti, well done!
Draught at pikkulintu, helsinki. Hazy copper color, no head. Sweet malty aroma. Sweet taste, could be stronger. Not my favorite this one.

Draught @ Brewpub.
Pours hazy orange color with a small off-white head. Aroma of caramel, yeast, mild herbal and juniper notes, some mild banana as well. Flavour of banana, herbs, mild spice notes, yeast, ripe fruits and some toffee. Smooth a bit creamy palate, smooth finish. Quite nice.
4324

Draught at the Pikkulintu, Helsinki, Finland.
Cloudy dark golden colour with tiny head.
Sweet sugary aroma with strong banana and toffee. 
Flavour is sugar, banana, toffee and mild maltiness.
Quite easy but not bad Sahti. Very sweet.

0,33 l on tap @ Harrys. Pours hazy orange with a low head. Aroma is malts and banana. Flavor is malts with plenty of banana. Easy to drink, as a sahti should be. Nothing special, just a good basic sahti.

Draught @ Harrys
Pours hazy orange with medium head. Aroma is yeast, malts, brown sugar and some banana. Flavor is alcohol, some plastic, yeast, sweetish, banana and dry hay. Not as good as I expcted.
0.25l at Pikkulintu, Helsinki. Aroma has malts and banana. Flavours were malts, banana, some sweetness and berries. Sweetness was not exaggerated and alcohol was well hidden. Great sahti.

(Draught at Pikkulintu, 20121010) The beer poured brown and cloudy. Its head was small and white. Aroma had juniper, banana and malts. Palate was medium bodied with low carbonation. Flavours were malts, banana, juniper, sweetness and bitterness. Aftertaste had sweetness, banana and bitterness. A nice sahti. A bit too much banana but otherwise no problems.

UPDATED: OCT 26, 2014 
Draught @ the brewpub
Aroma is sweetish and rather high on banana esthers. Also some strawberries and yeast. Flavour has banana esthers, some alcohol and hints of strawberries. Also some yeasty savor occurs after some sips. Sticky and somewhat floury palate. The alcohol is mostly warming and disturbs only little. Becomes a bit boozy when warms up though. Could be more rich but good still.

Draught @ Olut Expo Finland 2014
Quite floury and strong on juniper this year. Also messy and not as good as 2012.

UPDATED: OCT 10, 2013 Draught @ the brewpub. 2012 version.
Pours a hazy, murky brown colour with a small foamy head. Aroma of sweet banana and some pungent juniper. Flavour of malts, banana, rye, wood, grassy hops and mellow caramel notes. Juniper feels after a while. Medium bodied, soft carbonation and a smooth malty and sweet finish with strong yeastiness. Alcohol warms nicely. Not too sweet and overall a proper sahti. 7-3-8-3-14 3.5
Draught @ the brewpub. 2013 version.
Pours a slightly cloudy amber colour with a white head. Strong and pungent aroma of full-on juniper twigs,  juniper berries and wood. Flavour is pretty much the same as last year, but it has very little banana now. Juniper runs over everything, which is good. Yeast is well hidden. Id say this is much better than last year. 8-3-8-3-15 3.7
